fields.Video Description: Recorded in New Town, North Dakota, USA. Junior Garcia is a language teacher, activist, and member of the Lakota Nation. He recently appeared in Rising Voices, a documentary about the Lakota community's language revitalization efforts, produced by The Language Conservancy: http://on.fb.me/1MevhaW. The Lakota language is spoken by about 6,000 people, primarily in the US American states of North Dakota, South Dakota, Nebraska, Minnesota and Montana. A Sioux language, Lakota is closely related to Dakotan varieties such as Yankton and Santee. Read more on Wikipedia: http://bit.ly/1OZNtnG.
Demographics: 6,000 in United States (1997 R. Pustet), decreasing. 25,000 L1 speakers of all Sioux dialects in a total population of 103,000 (Golla 2007). Population total all countries: 6,190. Ethnic population: 20,000 (1997 R. Pustet). 103,255 ethnic Sioux in the United States (1990 census).
YouTube License Statement: The speaker(s) featured herein have not explicitly agreed to distribute this video for reuse. For inquiries on licensing this video, please contact hello@wikitongues.org.
fields.Geneaology: "[ Siouan-Catawban, Siouan, Mississippi Valley-Ohio Valley Siouan, Mississippi Valley Siouan, Dakota ]"
